title: Baobab Trees
author: Unknown
pages:
Baobab Trees are
incredibly large trees
that can live up to
3,000 years. Native to
Madagascar and
Mainland Africa.
Baobabs store water
in their trunks for the
dry African seasons.
Animals like baboons,
warthogs and weavers
all rely on these
trees for food or
shelter. Their

creased trunks and
hollowed interiors
also provide homes to
countless reptiles,
insects and bats
